technology.name: Dominion Over Mortals
technology.description: The smallfolk will obey… if they wish to live.

effects.description: Loyalty: +2 for new recruits
Control: +2

technology.name: The Pirate Code
technology.description: "Yarrr, it's a code of conduct - articles, if you will. Think of it as insurance, like."

effects.description: Lord recruitment cost: -60%

technology.name: Serrated Harpoon
technology.description: There’s no wriggling out of this one – the harpoon-blade has a barbed edge which tears the flesh of monstrous targets as they struggle to escape.

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +3 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob (Polearms) and Depth Guard (Polearms) units

technology.name: The Converted
technology.description: Outstanding veterans, seasoned and with common cause and purpose, are invaluable to the seafaring adventurer.

effects.description: [HIDDEN]Hero recruit rank: +5
Hero recruit rank: +4

technology.name: Disreputable Admiral
technology.description: It only takes a bit of light flogging and denial of shore leave for a less-than-stellar reputation to develop.

effects.description: Adds the Vampire Fleet Admiral (Vampires) Trusty Montford to your faction's Lord pool

technology.name: Command Crews
technology.description: A place for everyone and everyone in their place.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob units

technology.name: Foreign Architects
technology.description: Pirates have little time for landlubbing matters, so the expertise needed is drafted in from elsewhere.

effects.description: Construction cost: -8% for Infrastructure buildings

technology.name: Silver Musket-Balls & Cutlasses
technology.description: "Just keep them pistols pointed away from your own Vampire Admirals, maties!"

effects.description: Bonus vs Infantry: +3 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units

technology.name: Marines' Upkeep
technology.description: If you can keep your head while all around you are literally losing theirs…

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Depth Guard and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Unliving Reflexes
technology.description: Those controlled by occult means confound their putrid, decrepit forms.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Depth Guard and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Admirals’ Astrolabes
technology.description: A good pirate has the instruments to plot the safest course through the deadliest of seas.

effects.description:
Immune to Storm and Reef attrition
	(all armies)

technology.name: Infamous Admiral
technology.description: "I knew a man who served under 'em once - they takes no prisoners 'n' gives no quarter whatsoever."

effects.description: Adds the Vampire Fleet Admiral (Deeps) O'Bones Macdonald to your faction's Lord pool

technology.name: Protection Racket
technology.description: "You pay us and we keep the darkness at bay… After all, you wouldn't want one of your loved ones to have an... 'accident', would you?"

effects.description: Income from Ports: +8%

technology.name: Hardened Pirate Scum
technology.description: There's no substitute for experience.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob, Depth Guard and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Raise the Masses
technology.description: "Our power shall grow greater and greater with every tide…"

effects.description: Growth: +5

technology.name: Centuries in Command
technology.description: If you're still at sea centuries later and not dead or starving in a gibbet somewhere, chances are you're doing something right.

effects.description: [HIDDEN]Lord recruit rank: +5
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +5

technology.name: Notorious Admiral
technology.description: Notoriety can be acquired for a number of reasons, but mostly for those of the insalubrious kind.

effects.description: Adds the Vampire Fleet Admiral (Death) Burke Black to your faction's Lord pool

technology.name: Quartermaster
technology.description: The more brains you have, the more - and better - loot you will bring back to port.

effects.description: Grants the Quartermaster follower to your faction

technology.name: First Mate
technology.description: Keeping the crew on side is important if you wish to remain in charge. A loyal chain of command helps with this.

effects.description: Grants the First Mate follower to your faction

technology.name: Seascape Artist
technology.description: It's useful to get an idea of what your destination looks like, as there's barely a moment to think once the cannons start.

effects.description: Grants the Seascape Artist follower to your faction

technology.name: Unliving Labour Force
technology.description: Obedient and unquestioning, if a little slack-jawed.

effects.description: Construction time: -30% for all buildings

technology.name: Dread Admiral
technology.description: "Nah - I'll tell yer - you see that banner, you turn the ship around, as they'll be upon yer before you can scream 'Manann, protect us!'"

effects.description: Adds the Vampire Fleet Admiral (Deeps) Two Toes Adley to your faction's Lord pool

technology.name: Maintained Cannons
technology.description: "That's right, lad, get that sponge right down inside - we want to blow the enemy to kingdom come, not ourselves!"

effects.description: Missile strength: +8% for Mortar, Carronade, Deck Gunners, and Queen Bess units

technology.name: Magazine
technology.description: …because running out of shot during a violent seaborne action is not an option.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Mortar, Carronade, Deck Gunners, and Queen Bess units

technology.name: Trained Gun Hands
technology.description: Practice goes a long way towards preparing a crew for the real thing.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Mortar, Carronade, and Deck Gunners units

technology.name: Corrupt the Land
technology.description: "All shall know that we are here as masters to rule!"

effects.description:
Vampiric corruption: +3
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Supernatural Regeneration
technology.description: "Rise, me hearties, risssssssse!"

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10%

technology.name: Straining at the Leash
technology.description: "Blurgggh! Blurgggh! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaarrggh!!!!"

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Animated Hulks, Mournguls, Rotting Prometheans, and Rotting Leviathan units
Charge bonus: +15 for Animated Hulks, Mournguls, Rotting Prometheans, and Rotting Leviathan units

technology.name: Gunnery Crews
technology.description: Battles at sea are tense, nerve-wracking and bloody. Obey orders - and quickly - if you want to survive.

effects.description: Missile strength: +4% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Clean Yer Bores!
technology.description: Leaving residue inside a cannon between battles is a sure-fire way of blowing yourselves up! A good maintenance schedule guards against this.

effects.description: Upkeep: -8% for Mortar, Carronade, Deck Gunners and Queen Bess units

technology.name: Stolen Imperial Ordnance
technology.description: What they don't have really *can* hurt them quite badly, as it turns out!

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +10% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units

technology.name: Steadier Aim
technology.description: Being technically dead can have its advantages when the fight reaches screaming pitch.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob and Deck Droppers units

technology.name: Salvage Crews
technology.description: Death is no escape.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob and Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Efficient Necromancy
technology.description: Knowing the shortcuts, and how best to deploy them, saves time when it really counts.

effects.description: Raise dead cost: -5%

technology.name: Protection from the Elements
technology.description: "No elemental power shall halt them, nor spell nor hex nor charm…"

effects.description: Spell resistance: 25% for Animated Hulks, Bloated Corpse, and Mourngul units

technology.name: Reinforced Carcasses
technology.description: Magical protection is useful, but cannonballs take the limbs and lives of precious beasts.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 20% for Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units

technology.name: Black Powder Oxides
technology.description: The hotter the explosion, the more easily their rags and dry bones will light up.

effects.description: Missile strength: +5% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob, Deck Droppers and Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Percussion Caps
technology.description: "Flintlocks are a thing of the past; today, we sail into a dark, bloody future."

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Zombie Pirate Gunnery Mob, Deck Droppers and Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob units

technology.name: Forged-Steel Shot
technology.description: Even Dwarfen armour twists and cracks under a barrage of Nuln-forged steel.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Necrofex Colossus units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +8% for Necrofex Colossus units

technology.name: Salvaged Arsenal
technology.description: The best way to fell an empire is to use their own weapons and armour against them.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +6% for Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob and Depth Guard units

technology.name: Protective Hide
technology.description: It won't save you from a cannonball in the face, but smaller, indirect shot may be deflected.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 25% for Scurvy Dogs, Fell Bats, Deck Droppers, and Death Shriek Terrorgheist units

technology.name: Enduring Reanimation
technology.description: Bound to their captain's will for eternity and beyond.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Animated Hulks, Bloated Corpse, Syreens, Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Mournguls, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Animated Hulks, Syreens, Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Mournguls, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units (minimum 1)

technology.name: Throwing-Bombs
technology.description: Not as important when the bomber is already dead, but a full complement of limbs should remain a priority.

effects.description: Grants the Throwing Bombs banner to your faction

technology.name: Powder Monkey
technology.description: Warships are cramped, hot and dirty, so keeping a small, eager youth around to bring up powder from below makes a lot of sense.

effects.description: Grants the Powder Monkey follower to your faction

technology.name: Master Gunner
technology.description: An expert in his field, able to keep his head under pressure and with a dead-eyed stare.

effects.description: Grants the Master Gunner follower to your faction

technology.name: Skull & Crossbones
technology.description: "Come on, me hearties, let's get at 'em… Yarrrr!!!!!!!"

effects.description: Grants the Skull & Crossbones banner to your faction

technology.name: Spell of the Necromancer’s Apprentice
technology.description: "Power of Undeath, flow through my fingers and align their fallen hearts to my will!"

effects.description: Grants the Spell of the Necromancer's Apprentice banner to your faction

technology.name: Ship's Carpenter
technology.description: The ship's carpenter repairs battle and storm damage - often whilst they rage and writhe about him!

effects.description: Grants the Ship's Carpenter follower to your faction
